titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate concerning the individual Indian money account trust fund lawsuit.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate concerning the individual Indian money account trust fund lawsuit.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Senate Committee on Indian Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) the interests of Indian beneficiaries and the United States would best be served by a voluntary alternative dispute resolution process, not limited to mediation, that will lead to a full, fair, and final settlement of potential individual Indian money account claims; and (2) Federal legislation may be necessary to ensure a full, fair, and final resolution of specified class action litigation.
